doc:div.p: See a summary of recent highlights here, but use these forums to keep up to date with all developments:

ul.li:
There is a mailing list dedicated to RabbitMQ. Everyone is welcome to join and ask questions but please make sure your question hasn't been answered before by searching the archives. Two interfaces are available for this:
A read-only Mailman interface which also provides information on how to subscribe directly
A full web-interface provided Nabble

RabbitMQ developers are also sometimes available to chat rabbitmq on irc.freenode.net (see also http://freenode.net/) in channel #rabbitmq -- irc://irc.freenode.net/rabbitmq.
The logs of these conversations are available here: http://dev.rabbitmq.com/irclog/.
You can use this web interface to freenode if you don't have an IRC client installed.
To report a bug or problem email legitimategrievance@rabbitmq.com!
We are also working on a development wiki: http://dev.rabbitmq.com/wiki/.
